title: Little Mouse
author: Little Mouse
content: I heard this term a lot of times in the last few weeks but I couldn't manage the time to explore it. I want to know everything in detail about Bitcoin Ordinal so I can write an article in Bengali, for the Bengali cryptocurrency news site I'm writing. Where should I start? Especially I'm looking for some forum discussion/guidelines on Bitcoin Ordinal. There are articles on a lot of platforms but no one can make it as easy and friendly as bitcointalk. Please share me the informative threads on Bitcoin Ordinal. I found a few threads but all of them were some specific questions.

comments.author: SushiMonster
comments.body: This was a pretty exciting link when I tried Googling it.https://cointelegraph.com/explained/what-are-bitcoin-ordinalsThis is the first time I found out about this. It's exciting to know that there is something like this created this year by Casey Rodarmor. Would this be a new trend or something?

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: This is the only guide I used when I first encountered ordinals: https://docs.ordinals.com/introduction.html.From what I understand, ordinals are essentially serial numbers assigned to satoshis to make them unique and trackable during transactions. However, I came across a post here that suggests ordinals may not be as unique as we think, just can't remember what that thread is...Edit: it is from pooyah: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5437787.msg61756223#msg61756223

comments.author: Pterosaur
comments.body: Bitcoin ordinals are NFTs right? But there are few Bitcoin ordinal projects on the market right now, is anyone investing on them? They have their own native tokens and one is ordinal finance, where you borrow and lend? Are these projects worth investing your money on?
